Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2008 02:47AM DeirdreJeanne wrote: Hi,  Cyber  & prayers going your way.   I am a nine year survivor of advanced BC.  When I was diagnosed my kids were 12 and 2 years old, so I understand your anxiety.  My mets are triple neg., but I don't have any advice.   Waiting can be the hardest,  if it's cancer, we just want to kick its butt!!!!!  Best to you, Dee

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2008 12:09AM DeirdreJeanne wrote: Cute, cute! When I saw "furry buddy", it made me think of my first wig 9 years ago. My kids called it "Furby".  Hee, hee.  Best to you, Dee
Posts.Title: Your Furry Buddy JoyRebecca heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: May 6, 2008 04:11AM DeirdreJeanne wrote: Melody, Sending you a big cyber hug.  I'm a nine year survivor of stage III, & 3 years with mets.  I was 39, my younger child 2 yrs. old, so I had a lot to fight for, and I bet you do too.  A favorite onc. nurse told me early on you are not a statistic!!   I do not mean to force my faith on you, but have a verse from Romans 8:37.  "For I am convinced that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor rulers, nor things present, nor things to come . . . will be able to separate us from the love of God in Christ Jesus our Lord."  Best to you, Dee
Posts.Title: I'm tired charenm MariaC

Posts.Content: May 7, 2008 12:16PM - edited May 8, 2008 07:11AM by DeirdreJeanne Chris and Sofeemay, My mets are triple neg. from the biopsy of pleural effusion.  The other mets (brain, liver, spine, chest cavity,) was based on MRI, but couldn't start treatment without biopsy.  It had "morphed" from my origiinal ER+/PR+HER2- in 1999.  So, it is a long, weary process for us to go through, I understand the frustration.  My second opinions are through Dana Farber in Boston, (about 1-1/2 hours away).    My treatment is at a local clinic, my oncologist is a genius (who doesn't mind conferring with DFC), & the nurses are so good!   I take Xeloda (hot feet side effect), Avastin (slight nosebleed and very dry throat and nose).  Had Zometa once and lucky me got the rare "flu like symptom". FYI TRIPLE NEG.S  , Dana Farber, Boston is offering a clinical trial for triple neg mets with Cisplatin as first line chemo.  Best to all our sisters, Dee
Posts.Title: Yup, It's lung mets and I'm triple neg sofeemay LuAnnH

Posts.Content: May 5, 2008 06:55AM DeirdreJeanne wrote: Hi Sofeemay, Sorry to hear about yr. lung and being inpatient, and another young BC.  I had a lung lobe removed in '05 due to mets, and it went OK.   My new mets (many) are triple neg.   I take oral Xeloda.  The S/E I got was burning feet, had to stay off my feet a lot, put in cool water and use lots of cream on them.  It happened after 4 weeks on and feeling better now on week off.  So it's manageable.  Good luck on yr. scans.  Our MRI has piped in radio (or yr. own CD) maybe yours does too.  Hope all goes well, Dee
Posts.Title: Yup, It's lung mets and I'm triple neg sofeemay LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2009 04:13PM DeirdreJeanne wrote: Liz, I had progression after 4 yrs. on Arimidex, my pleural effusion biopsy came back  triple negative, so I stopped Arimidex & went on chemo.   My experience was the hormone status change meant different treatment options.  Hope you get some good info. at your appointment.   Deirdre

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2008 04:05AM DeirdreJeanne wrote: My most recent mets were triple neg.  The Dana Farber offered a clinical trial for Cisplatin (an older chemo).  The trial was for first chemo for triple neg. mets which might not apply  to you, but was told Cisplatin is readily available outside of trial.  The doctor I saw was DR. Leroy Parker, DFCC, Boston, Mass.  Best to you, Dee

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2008 08:34PM DeirdreJeanne wrote: The Xeloda website had a video that talked about the recommended 2 weeks on schedule to hit the "S" phase.  I started Xeloda  when in brain radiation, (very unusual) My onc. said may have less side effects.  I put my feet in lukewarm water, and that took the burn away until I stood for about an hour.  Trying to get more Udderly Smooth cream in the jar (it is fab), but our walmart was out, so meanwhile I use eucerin. Dee
